post.description: This endpoint serves several purposes. 1. It provides the org with default roles. This is important for default roles that will be added after go-live (they can retroactively add the new default-role). Note: When not using a query param of force=true, it only adds the default roles not configured for the org; it does not overwrite roles. 2. Using the query param force=true, you can restore all default roles. Note: This does not have an effect on custom roles.

get.description: This method requires the download sharing URI obtained in the get document response (downloadSharingUri). Documents may be shared between users in the same workspace. Documents may also be shared between any user by creating a content management share.

parameters.name: disposition
parameters.description: Request how the share content will be downloaded: attached as a file or inline. Default is attachment.

200.description: Download location is returned in header, if redirect is set to false and disposition is not set to none. If disposition is none, location header will not be populated, DownloadUri and ViewUri will be populated.

202.description: Accepted - Preparing file for download - try again soon.

307.description: Redirected to download location, if redirect is set to true

post.description:
The OAuth Grant/Client is required in order to create an authentication token and gain access to PureCloud. 
The preferred authorizedGrantTypes is 'CODE' which requires applications to send a client ID and client secret. This is typically a web server. 
If the client is unable to secure the client secret then the 'TOKEN' grant type aka IMPLICIT should be used. This is would be for browser or mobile apps.
This operation will set the client secret to a randomly generated cryptographically random value. All clients must be updated with the new secret. This operation should be used with caution.

SheetSchemas.description: A list of all the schemas for a XLSX file. Each schema represents a different sheet's schema.

CarrierId.description: Carrier ID associated with this CSV schema.

searchResults.description: The actual results from the search
searchResults.$ref: #/definitions/LinkedEntityListingWorkItem Entry Found In Result To A Search.

facetResults.description: The results from the facet requests for this search - note ALL facets will always be returned regardless of page size/starting pagenumber in the searchRequest

items.$ref: #/definitions/Used as part of the searchResult to return facet results to the caller

name.description: Field to filter on. Allowed values are 'name' and 'libraryId.

certificate.description: The authorities signed X509 PEM encoded certificate.

type.description: The certificate authorities type.  Managed certificate authorities are generated and maintained by Interactive Intelligence.  These are read-only and not modifiable by clients.  Remote authorities are customer managed.

services.description: The service(s) that the authority can be used to authenticate.

certificateDetails.description: The details of the parsed certificate(s).

items.$ref: #/definitions/Represents the details of a parsed certificate.

flowExecId.description: The flow instance ID that created this WorkItem

flowConfigId.description: The flow config ID that this workitem was created from.
flowConfigId.$ref: #/definitions/ID of a Flow Definition with an optional version

flowCreateTime.description: The time the flow was started. (that created this workitem)

createTime.description: The time this workitem was started.

owner.description: The user currently working on/has responsibility for this WorkItem.  May be null if no owner.

offeredToUsers.description: List of users that this workItem is offered to.  May be null if only offered to groups.

offeredToGroups.description: List of groups that this workItem is offered to.  May be null if only offered to users.

associatedDocuments.description: The documents associated with this workitem

items.$ref: #/definitions/Contains information about the Document associated with a workItem

availableActions.description: The actions that the user can take on this workitem (submit, transfer, etc).

dataValueInfo.description: The data items that provide values for any work item form elements, if applicable.

workItemCache.description: The data items in the current work item cache, if one exists.

lastOfferedTime.description: The time this work item was last offered to a user or group.

lastOwnershipUpdateTime.description: The most recent time a user assumed ownership of a work item. This may be blank if the work item has no owner.

currentTaskStartTime.description: This is the time when the current task that started the work item was started.

time.description: The time at which this phone was provisioned

errorInfo.description: The error information from the provision process, if any

owner.description: A Uri reference to the owner of this DID, which is either a User or an IVR

items.$ref: #/definitions/A certificate authority represents an organization that has issued a digital certificate for making secure connections with an edge device.

versionSpecificComment.description: Checkin comment for this specific flow version.

flowDefinitionUri.description: Uri location for the flow definition contents.

flowDefinitionUploaded.description: true if the version has its definition properly uploaded.

createdByUser.description: If known, the user who created this flow version.

createdDate.description: The date and time that the version was created.

listTotal.description: The quote charge total price before discounts.

total.description: The quote charge total price after discounts.

listPriceDisplay.description: The quote charge list price before discounts.

effectivePrice.description: The quote charge list price after discounts.

productShippable.description: Indicates whether the product can be shipped.

startPhoneNumber.description: The starting phone number for the range of this DID pool. Must be in E.164 format

endPhoneNumber.description: The ending phone number for the range of this DID pool. Must be in E.164 format

provider.description: The provider for this DID pool

libraries.description: One or more libraries response is associated with.

texts.description: One or more texts associated with the response.

items.$ref: #/definitions/Contains information about the text associated with a response.

dateCreated.description: The date and time the response was created

workItemExecId.description: The workItem instance ID that owns this cache.

saveTime.description: The time that the workItem cache was last saved.

saveUser.description: The user that last saved the workItem cache.

saveComment.description: An optional comment made during the last save

dataItems.description: The data items that are present within the cache.

isFrozen.description: Indicates whether the account is currently frozen for review.

isTaxExempt.description: Indicates whether the account is tax exempt.

speakTo.description: Determines to whom the initiating participant is speaking. Defaults to DESTINATION

voicemailExtension.description: The extension for voicemail retrieval.  The default value is *86.

pinRequired.description: If this is true, a PIN is required when accessing a user's voicemail from a phone.

stateExecId.description: The identifier of the execution instance of this State.

stateConfigId.description: The identifier of the definition of this State.

stateName.description: The displayable name of this State.

requestName.description: This was the name passed in as part of the facetRequest

requestFieldName.description: The field name that the facet was requested for.

fieldType.description: data type of the field being returned (if this is a mixed field this will be unknown)

requestType.description: the facet request type that was made.

name.description: For TERM facets this will contain the value of the term that was found userid, docid, etc.

count.description: The number of items that matched the facetRequest.

flowConfigId.$ref: #/definitions/ID of a Flow Definition with an optional version

query.description: Search terms can be AND'd together. Example: foo AND bar

order.description: Sort order of results by score or most recent. Default is by score

targetJids.description: A list of XMPP JIDs to consider. Default is all permissible JIDs. A permissible JID is defined as any JID of a person with whom you have chatted, or any group in which you are currently a member.

pageSize.description: The maximum number of hits to receive in the response. Default: 10, Maximum: 50]

pageNumber.description: The number of hits to skip before returning results. Default: 0

start.description: The start date for this schedule. If this is set to a value that does not match the rrule, the date portion will be updated to match the date of the next possible recurrence

end.description: The end date for this schedule. This date will also be modifiedif the start date is modified to match the recurrence rule

name.description: The name of the rate csv.

url.description: The url of the rate csv.

name.description: name of the facet request that will be returned with the result set

fieldName.description: The fieldName to perform the facet request on.

type.description: the fieldtype of the field to perform the facet request on.

rangeFrom.description: For RANGE requests populate this field to specify the beginning of a limit (leave blank for openended).  Note this value is inclusive of the results.  (EG if the value is 1, 1 will be included in the range.)

rangeTo.description: For RANGE requests populate this field to specify the end of a limit (leave blank for openended).  Note this value is EXCLUSIVE of the result (EG if this value was 5, only values LESS THAN 5 will be included in the count.)

maxFacetCount.description: Limits/expands the number of facet entries returned (default 500)

document.description: the document associated with the workitem

recordingState.description: On update, 'paused' initiates a secure pause, 'active' resumes any paused recordings; otherwise indicates state of conversation recording

configState.description: Usability of this flow definition. (output only)

flowType.description: Type of flow this definition describes

lockedByUser.description: If locked for editing, the user who locked this definition, otherwise null

newestPublishedVersion.description: The most recently published version (output only)

newestVersion.description: The most recent version, regardless of published state (output only)

description.description: User notes describing the flow definition.

items.$ref: #/definitions/Details about a specific Flow Definition version.

searchPhrase.description: The search text to look for

pageNumber.description: The pageNumber to get results from (EG If there are 100 results with a pageSize of 10 and pageNumber is 3 then 10 results will be returned starting with index #31

pageSize.description: Number of entries to return/calculate per page.

searchFields.description: The fields to limit the searchPhrase search to

facetRequests.description: List of facet requests to generate summary views from the search result set (if any)

items.$ref: #/definitions/Used as part of a searchRequest or reportRequest to denote which facets to generate from the search results.  For RANGE facets, one of rangeFrom or rangeTo (or both) MUST be set

sort.description: sort the results on a field(s)

filters.description: You can also restrict the search to particular field values and ranges

domain.description: Fully qualified domain name for this organization (Ex. example.com).

thirdPartyOrgName.description: Organization Name which does not contain special characters like spaces.

queryPhrase.description: Query phrase to search response text and name. If not set will match all.

pageSize.description: The maximum number of hits to return. Default: 25, Maximum: 500.

HeaderRow.description: Row number for the XLSX sheet's headers.  This is zero indexed (i.e. 0 is row 1).

DataRow.description: Row number of the first line of data in the sheet.  This is zero indexed (i.e. 0 is row 1)

HeaderMappings.description: XLSX sheet header name to object name mappings. For example, "ROUTE_TEL_PREFIX" to "Prefix" might be one such mapping.

SheetNumber.description: Sheet number within the XLSX file.  This is zero indexed (i.e. 0 is page 1).

DateFormat.description: A date format that represents the date time stamp you want to parse. This is based on the reference time of Mon Jan 2 15:04:05 MST 2006. For example, if you had the date 13-OCT-2015, this parameter should be 02-Jan-2006. As another example, if you have the date 2014-09-20, this parameter should be 2006-01-02.

items.$ref: #/definitions/An additional data element that was set by the user for this event.

accessTokenValiditySeconds.description: The number of seconds, between 5mins and 48hrs, until tokens created with this client expire. If this field is omitted, a default of 24 hours will be applied.

authorizedGrantTypes.description: One or more OAuth Grant/Client types supported by this client.

registeredRedirectUri.description: List of allowed callbacks for this client. For example: https://myap.example.com/auth/callback

secret.description: System created secret assigned to this client. Secrets are required for code authorization grants.

commandId.description: The command associated with the submit request. Often it is the button pressed on the user interface.

dataItems.description: The data items that should be a part of the submit request.

status.description: The status of the phone and lines from the primary Edge.

secondaryStatus.description: The status of the phone and lines from the secondary Edge.

source.description: Represents the source where the Presence was set. Some examples are: PURECLOUD, LYNC, OUTLOOK, etc.

flowConfigId.description: The FlowConfigId that was used to launch this flow.
flowConfigId.$ref: #/definitions/ID of a Flow Definition with an optional version

launchTime.description: The time the flow was launched.

launchType.description: The launch mode for this flow instance.

launchedBy.description: The user who launched the flow, if the flow was launched as the result of that user's action.

status.description: The flow's running status, which indicates whether the flow is running normally or completed, etc.

associatedDocuments.description: The documents associated with this flow.

items.$ref: #/definitions/Contains information about the Document associated with a workItem

flowCompletionTime.description: The time the flow completed, if applicable.

flowCompletionReason.description: The completion reason set at the flow completion time, if applicable.

flowErrorInfo.description: Additional information if the flow is in error

iterationsInPhase.description: Approximate number of iterations to perform in this phase

acl.description: A list of permitted action rights for the user making the request

startNumber.description: The starting phone number for the range of this Extension pool. Must be in E.164 format

endNumber.description: The ending phone number for the range of this Extension pool. Must be in E.164 format

operationalStatus.description: The Operational Status of this phone

edgesStatus.description: The status of the primary or secondary Edges assigned to the phone lines.

lineStatuses.description: A list of LineStatus information for each of the lines of this phone

phoneAssignmentToEdgeType.description: The phone status's edge assignment type.

edge.description: The URI of the edge that provided this status information.

type.description: The 'type' of the element, this may be a system value, EG 'STRING' or a user defined type

value.description: The value of the element itself - This may be a simple value or more complex serialized data.

prompt.description: The prompt displayed to the user that this data item was set from.

displayValue.description: The display value that was offered to the user (as opposed to the actual value used internally

locked.description: Change the locked state of the flow definition.  True to attempt to lock for modification, false to release the lock.

linkedDocumentIds.description: A list of document IDs to link with the new flow instance.

CarrierId.description: Carrier ID associated with this CSV schema.

HeaderRow.description: Row number for the CSV's headers.  This is zero indexed (i.e. 0 is row 1).

DataRow.description: Row number of the first line of data.  This is zero indexed (i.e. 0 is row 1).

HeaderMappings.description: CSV header name to object name mappings. For example, "ROUTE_TEL_PREFIX" to "Prefix" might be one such mapping.

DateFormat.description: A date format that represents the date time stamp you want to parse. This is based on the reference time of Mon Jan 2 15:04:05 MST 2006. For example, if you had the date 13-OCT-2015, this parameter should be 02-Jan-2006. As another example, if you have the date 2014-09-20, this parameter should be 2006-01-02.

currency.description: The ISO 4217 currency code of the voice rate.

amendmentId.description: The amendment Id of the voice rate.

items.$ref: #/definitions/WorkItem entry found in result to a search.

reachable.description: Indicates whether the edge can reach the line.

contactAddresses.description: The addresses used to contact the line.

reachableStateTime.description: The time the line entered its current reachable state.

items.$ref: #/definitions/Details about the current state of a Flow Definition

destinationParticipantId.description: Participant ID to whom the call is being transferred.

flowInstance.description: The flow instance information that applies to the history events.
flowInstance.$ref: #/definitions/Details about the current state of a Flow Instance

availableActions.description: The actions available for operating in the flow, with respect to your authorization identity.

historyItems.description: The ordered list of history events for this flow.

issuer.description: Information about the issuer of the certificate.  The value of this property is a comma separated key=value format.  Each key is one of the attribute names supported by X.500.

subject.description: Information about the subject of the certificate.  The value of this property is a comma separated key=value format.  Each key is one of the attribute names supported by X.500.

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the certificate.

issueDate.description: The issue date of the certificate.

expired.description: True if the certificate is expired, false otherwise.

flowConfigVersionSource.description: Source version that the flow was published from.

transferTargetType.description: The type of the transferTarget, indicating whether you want to transfer to a User, or a Queue, etc.

transferTarget.description: The destination to where the work item should be transferred.

owner.description: A Uri reference to the owner of this extension, which is either a User or an IVR

id.description: The configuration ID for this workItem

commandCategories.description: The commands that can be performed on this work item

dataElements.description: The simple work item form data elements to present for this work item

activated.description: Change the activated state of the flow definition.  True to activate the flow definition so it can be launched, false to disable the flow.

items.$ref: #/definitions/Details about the current state of a Flow Instance

parameterName.description: The name of the data element associated with a history event.

parameterType.description: The type of the data element associated with a history event.

parameterValues.description: The values of the data element associated with a history event.

edgeAutoUpdateConfig.description: Recurrance rule, time zone, and start/end settings for automatic edge updates for this site

certificateDetails.description: The details of the certificates that were parsed correctly.

items.$ref: #/definitions/Represents the details of a parsed certificate.

workspaces.description: The list of Workspaces to associate with a flow.  Can be null/empty to remove associations.

swaggerUrl.description: The Url to the swagger documentation of the endpoint where parsed entities will be posted

ready.description: Whether this TransformEndpoint has been configured to work (security groups, permissions, etc)

active.description: Whether this TransformEndpoint is currently active and accepting transformation operations

batchSize.description: The number of entities to send in an array for batch POSTs, or 0 for unbatched POSTs

parallelism.description: The number of parallel POSTs to allow at once

filename.description: Name of the file being parsed

tags.description: Tag matching for searching transformation schemas in use

progress.description: State of parsing progress for this upload transformation

force.description: force the termination of a flow.

pattern.description: The search pattern that the mailbox name should match.

queue.description: The queue to route the emails to.

priority.description: The priority to use for routing.

skills.description: The skills to use for routing.

language.description: The language to use for routing.

fromName.description: The sender name to use for outgoing replies.

fromEmail.description: The sender email to use for outgoing replies.

spamThreshold.description: The maximum spam score for email that will be routed.

currency.description: The ISO 4217 currency code of the voice rate.

amendmentDate.description: The date of the rate amendment.

effectiveDate.description: The effective date of the rate amendment.

description.description: The description of this additional service.

partNumber.description: The part number of this additional service.

requiredForPartNumbers.description: The list of part numbers which require this additional service.

rate.description: The rate of this additional service.

flowExecId.description: The flow instance ID for this process

flowConfigId.description: The flow config ID that this workitem was created from.
flowConfigId.$ref: #/definitions/ID of a Flow Definition with an optional version

flowInstanceName.description: The instance name for this flow in relation to its primary document.  If the flow is not a document-centric type, this value will be empty.

associatedDocument.description: the document for this flow (if this flow was launched via a document)
associatedDocument.$ref: #/definitions/Contains information about the Document associated with a workItem

flowStatus.description: The flow's running status, which indicates whether the flow is running normally or in error, etc;

currentState.description: The current state of the flow (EG what action is being processed)

startDateTime.description: The time the flow was started.

workItemUserAssignees.description: List of users currently assigned to a workItem

flowErrorInfo.description: Additional information if the flow is in error

CarrierId.description: Carrier id associated with the ratesheet that was uploaded.

SchemaName.description: Human readable name for the schema that was used to parse the ratesheet.

Status.description: Human readable status for progress of the ratesheet upload. This may be an error, the number of rates upload, or a completion message.

Filename.description: Filename of the ratesheet that was uploaded by the user.

Created.description: Time at which the uploaded ratesheet was started to be parsed.

Updated.description: Time at which the progress of the upload was last updated.

speakTo.description: Determines to whom the initiating participant is speaking.

flowConfigId.description: ID of the flow to launch, will launch the most recently published version if a specific version is not specified.
flowConfigId.$ref: #/definitions/ID of a Flow Definition with an optional version

flowInstanceName.description: The displayable instance name to assign to the new flow instance (or omit to have one automatically generated)

inputData.description: contains launch parameters or initializations for variables in the flow.
inputData.$ref: #/definitions/launch parameters or initializations for variables in the flow.

launchType.description: launch type of the flow - NORMAL or TEST
